title: JICA to invest in Bangladesh higher edn
body: The Japan International Cooperation Agency expressed its interest to invest in Bangladesh’s higher education sector. A five-year project aimed at improving science and technology education at the country’s leading universities will be launched in 2028. A JICA delegation conveyed the interest at a courtesy call on with chairman of the University Grants Commission of Bangladesh, Professor SMA Faiz, on Wednesday, said a press release. UGC members Professor Mohammad Tanzimuddin Khan, Professor Mohammad Anwar Hossain, Professor Md Saidur Rahman, Professor Mashuma Habib, Professor Mohammad Ayub Islam, and director-additional charge of the international cooperation division Jesmin Parvin were present. The eight-member delegation was led by JICA’s deputy director general Daisuke Ueda. According to the release, if the project is implemented, Bangladeshi universities will be directly connected with Japan’s top research and technology institutions.
